title: I've Tried Everything, and These 5 Pore Strips Act Like a Magic Wand to Erase Blackheads
text: This may sound controversial and ridiculous, but I have to admit that I'm not the biggest fan of pores. Yes, they're essential to live, but why must they be so large and in charge? My nose, in particular, is a big-pore paradise and ground zero for blackheads. The best nose strips act like little miracle workers, purging those blackheads and getting out all the gunk. (Gentle reminder: Pores cannot actually shrink, but good skincare can reduce their appearance.)I'm old enough to remember when pore strips were the hottest thing, so they give me total late-'90s nostalgia. I vividly recall the first time I experienced that gross yet satisfying moment of peeling one off and examining the tiny forest of debris left behind. Pore strips get a bum rap sometimes, but when used correctly and sparingly, they can tackle clogged pores and oily buildup alongside a proper exfoliating routine.Pore strip technology has also improved over the years, including the options out there. There are ones that specifically target certain skin types or contain beneficial ingredients, and they available for budgets big and small. Ahead, you'll find a list of five pore strips that my big pores swear by.The Best Pore Strips at a GlanceBest Overall: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Nose Best Budget: Starface Lift Off Pore StripsBest for Sensitive Skin: Peach Slices Nose Pore PatchesBest for Oily Skin: Bioré Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore StripsBest Multipurpose: Rael Miracle Patch Blackhead Control 1. Best Overall: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Nose Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Nose Pros: Traps gunk and absorbs oil overnight Con: Some reviewers complain that it doesn't lay completely over their noseType: SheetKey ingredient: HydrocolloidThis isn’t your average pore strip, which is a big reason why it's at the top of my list. Hero Cosmetics took its cult-favorite pimple patch technology and turned it into a nose strip. Packed with hydrocolloid, these strips gently absorb oil and impurities while minimizing irritation. Customer review: "These patches really work! I leave it on overnight, and in the morning, it is filled with cloudy stuff from my dirty pores. My nose pores will stay clean for 2 weeks or more before I decide to do another patch. Very happy with this purchase and I will be buying these from now on instead of any blackhead strips." 2. Best Budget: Starface Lift Off Pore Strips Starface Lift Off Pore Strips Pros: Stylish and affordableCon: Not as heavy-duty as other pore stripsType: SheetKey ingredients: Aloe vera, witch hazel, and allantoinWhen it comes to skincare that's both super cute and functional, Starface always delivers. These yellow smiley face pore strips are as adorable as they are effective. While they may not be as heavy-duty as other ones, they still lift away dirt and oil from your pores, and you can't beat that price! Customer review: "I got introduced to these when I got them as a gift. After using, I immediately repurchased! So many pore strips feel like they're tearing off your skin. These Starface ones are much more gentle while still removing the nose gunk. Highly recommend!" 3. Best for Sensitive Skin: Peach Slices Nose Pore Patches Peach Slices Nose Pore Patches Pros: Nondrying and gentle for all skin typesCon: Some have issues keeping the strip onType: SheetKey ingredient: HydrocolloidFor my friends with sensitive skin, these are the pore strips you want in your arsenal. Like other products by Peach Slices (and sister brand Peach & Lily), these pore strips are great for sensitive skin yet still effective. They won't leave your skin feeling raw, and they're made with hydrocolloid to pull out the nastiness.Customer review: "I tend to stay to a skin routine and don't often get acne, but my nose has noticeable pores and feels kind of rough sometimes. The first time using it, only the tiny patches of white were noticeable. But my skin felt so soft and smooth and clean and it stayed that way for a week. My pores are no longer visible. Highly recommend." 4. Best Multipurpose: Rael Miracle Patch Blackhead Control Rael Miracle Patch Blackhead Control Pro: Hits clogged pores three different ways through K-beauty technologyCon: Some users find the black cotton swab unnecessaryType: SheetKey ingredients: JeJu mugwort extract, peppermint extract, and succinic acidThis is basically the king of pore strips—it has a three-step system that is serious business and good for anyone who wants to tackle congested pores any way possible. The three-step system comes with a nose strip for those pesky nose blackheads, cotton swabs to wipe away impurities, and another nose strip sheet that has the calming mugwort extract infused in it. Customer review: "After I have spent $$$ cheap and high-end stuff, I finally found something that works! Hated the white filaments on my nose every time. Since pregnancy, I cannot use anything irritating, or it will dry up my skin or break out. Found this one very effective, easy to use, pores are clean!" 5. Best for Oily Skin: Bioré Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore Strips Bioré Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore Strips Pro: Controls excess oilCon: Contains menthol, which some people don't likeType: SheetKey ingredient: CharcoalBioré is practically the OG of pore strips, and its charcoal-infused option is a must for those with oily and combination skin. The activated charcoal acts like a magnet to blackheads and clogged pores, drawing out even the deepest grime.Customer review: "I found these pore strips to be very effective. They really work on my skin, helping to remove blackheads and control oil, which is great. They're easy to use, and the deep cleansing power feels satisfying after each use. Overall, I like how they leave my skin feeling clean and refreshed, and the charcoal makes a noticeable difference." Marie has covered beauty, fashion, and lifestyle for almost 15 years. She contributes to the beauty section here at Who What Wear. Previously, she was the Looks Editor for Bust Magazine, built the beauty vertical at HelloGiggles as its beauty editor, and was a founding staff writer at Rookie mag, giving fashion advice to teens. Her bylines have appeared in The Cut, Allure, Glamour, The Hollywood Reporter, and more. She was born and raised in Southern California and is based in L.A. Marie is a self-proclaimed costume design nerd and a co-host of Makeover Montage, a podcast about fashion in film and costume design. You'll see her writing about her beauty obsessions: red lipstick, winged eyeliner, pink hair, nail art, and skincare for people over 40. When she's not working, she's playing with her dog, Gnocchi, and writing her style newsletter, Overdressed.
html:
This may sound controversial and ridiculous, but I have to admit that I'm not the biggest fan of pores. Yes, they're essential to live, but why must they be so large and in charge? My nose, in particular, is a big-pore paradise and ground zero for blackheads. The best nose strips act like little miracle workers, purging those blackheads and getting out all the gunk. (Gentle reminder: Pores cannot actually shrink, but good skincare can reduce their appearance.)

I'm old enough to remember when pore strips were the hottest thing, so they give me total late-'90s nostalgia. I vividly recall the first time I experienced that gross yet satisfying moment of peeling one off and examining the tiny forest of debris left behind. Pore strips get a bum rap sometimes, but when used correctly and sparingly, they can tackle clogged pores and oily buildup alongside a proper exfoliating routine.

Pore strip technology has also improved over the years, including the options out there. There are ones that specifically target certain skin types or contain beneficial ingredients, and they available for budgets big and small. Ahead, you'll find a list of five pore strips that my big pores swear by.

The Best Pore Strips at a Glance

  • Best Overall: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Nose
  • Best Budget: Starface Lift Off Pore Strips
  • Best for Sensitive Skin: Peach Slices Nose Pore Patches
  • Best for Oily Skin: Bioré Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore Strips
  • Best Multipurpose: Rael Miracle Patch Blackhead Control

1. Best Overall: Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch Nose

Hero Cosmetics

Mighty Patch Nose

Pros: Traps gunk and absorbs oil overnight

Con: Some reviewers complain that it doesn't lay completely over their nose

Type: Sheet

Key ingredient: Hydrocolloid

This isn’t your average pore strip, which is a big reason why it's at the top of my list. Hero Cosmetics took its cult-favorite pimple patch technology and turned it into a nose strip. Packed with hydrocolloid, these strips gently absorb oil and impurities while minimizing irritation.

Customer review: "These patches really work! I leave it on overnight, and in the morning, it is filled with cloudy stuff from my dirty pores. My nose pores will stay clean for 2 weeks or more before I decide to do another patch. Very happy with this purchase and I will be buying these from now on instead of any blackhead strips."

2. Best Budget: Starface Lift Off Pore Strips

Starface

Lift Off Pore Strips

Pros: Stylish and affordable

Con: Not as heavy-duty as other pore strips

Type: Sheet

Key ingredients: Aloe vera, witch hazel, and allantoin

When it comes to skincare that's both super cute and functional, Starface always delivers. These yellow smiley face pore strips are as adorable as they are effective. While they may not be as heavy-duty as other ones, they still lift away dirt and oil from your pores, and you can't beat that price!

Customer review: "I got introduced to these when I got them as a gift. After using, I immediately repurchased! So many pore strips feel like they're tearing off your skin. These Starface ones are much more gentle while still removing the nose gunk. Highly recommend!"

3. Best for Sensitive Skin: Peach Slices Nose Pore Patches

Peach Slices

Nose Pore Patches

Pros: Nondrying and gentle for all skin types

Con: Some have issues keeping the strip on

Type: Sheet

Key ingredient: Hydrocolloid

For my friends with sensitive skin, these are the pore strips you want in your arsenal. Like other products by Peach Slices (and sister brand Peach & Lily), these pore strips are great for sensitive skin yet still effective. They won't leave your skin feeling raw, and they're made with hydrocolloid to pull out the nastiness.

Customer review: "I tend to stay to a skin routine and don't often get acne, but my nose has noticeable pores and feels kind of rough sometimes. The first time using it, only the tiny patches of white were noticeable. But my skin felt so soft and smooth and clean and it stayed that way for a week. My pores are no longer visible. Highly recommend."

4. Best Multipurpose: Rael Miracle Patch Blackhead Control

Rael

Miracle Patch Blackhead Control

Pro: Hits clogged pores three different ways through K-beauty technology

Con: Some users find the black cotton swab unnecessary

Type: Sheet

Key ingredients: JeJu mugwort extract, peppermint extract, and succinic acid

This is basically the king of pore strips—it has a three-step system that is serious business and good for anyone who wants to tackle congested pores any way possible. The three-step system comes with a nose strip for those pesky nose blackheads, cotton swabs to wipe away impurities, and another nose strip sheet that has the calming mugwort extract infused in it.

Customer review: "After I have spent $$$ cheap and high-end stuff, I finally found something that works! Hated the white filaments on my nose every time. Since pregnancy, I cannot use anything irritating, or it will dry up my skin or break out. Found this one very effective, easy to use, pores are clean!"

5. Best for Oily Skin: Bioré Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore Strips

Bioré

Charcoal Deep Cleansing Pore Strips

Pro: Controls excess oil

Con: Contains menthol, which some people don't like

Type: Sheet

Key ingredient: Charcoal

Bioré is practically the OG of pore strips, and its charcoal-infused option is a must for those with oily and combination skin. The activated charcoal acts like a magnet to blackheads and clogged pores, drawing out even the deepest grime.

Customer review: "I found these pore strips to be very effective. They really work on my skin, helping to remove blackheads and control oil, which is great. They're easy to use, and the deep cleansing power feels satisfying after each use. Overall, I like how they leave my skin feeling clean and refreshed, and the charcoal makes a noticeable difference."

Marie has covered beauty, fashion, and lifestyle for almost 15 years. She contributes to the beauty section here at Who What Wear. Previously, she was the Looks Editor for Bust Magazine, built the beauty vertical at HelloGiggles as its beauty editor, and was a founding staff writer at Rookie mag, giving fashion advice to teens. Her bylines have appeared in The Cut, Allure, Glamour, The Hollywood Reporter, and more. She was born and raised in Southern California and is based in L.A. Marie is a self-proclaimed costume design nerd and a co-host of Makeover Montage, a podcast about fashion in film and costume design. You'll see her writing about her beauty obsessions: red lipstick, winged eyeliner, pink hair, nail art, and skincare for people over 40. When she's not working, she's playing with her dog, Gnocchi, and writing her style newsletter, Overdressed.
